name: Selina Kyle (Kravitz)
description: Selina Kyle, also known as Catwoman, is a nimble and cunning thief in 'The Batman (2022)' played by Zoë Kravitz.

content.title: Background
content.body: Selina Kyle is a skilled thief living in Gotham City. Her early life and the circumstances that led her to a life of crime are largely shrouded in mystery. In 'The Batman', she is introduced as someone deeply connected to the criminal underworld of Gotham, motivated by both personal gain and a sense of justice for those marginalized by society.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Selina Kyle is fiercely independent, resourceful, and driven by personal motives that sometimes align with greater causes. While she initially appears to serve her own interests, she demonstrates a complex moral code, revealing empathy and willingness to assist others, particularly when confronting the corruption that plagues Gotham. Her enigmatic and dual nature makes her both a potential ally and adversary.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: In 'The Batman (2022)', Selina Kyle plays a crucial role as a supporting character whose own investigation intertwines with Batman's mission to uncover Gotham's deep-seated corruption. Her alliances shift throughout the film as her true motives are gradually revealed, and her relationship with Batman develops into a complicated partnership.

content.title: Relationships
content.body: Selina Kyle has a complicated relationship with Bruce Wayne (Batman), portrayed by Robert Pattinson. Their dynamic evolves from wary adversaries to allies with a deep understanding of each other's motives and abilities. She is also connected to Gotham's criminal elements, including Carmine Falcone, a notable crime lord in the city.

content.title: Abilities
content.body: Selina Kyle is highly skilled in stealth, hand-to-hand combat, and burglary, making her one of the most adept thieves in Gotham. Her agility and expertise in self-defense are matched by her sharp intellect and ability to navigate complex social environments to extract information and influence outcomes.
